text: Oreosaurus shrevei, known commonly as the luminous lizard or Shreve's lightbulb lizard, is a species of lizard in the family Gymnophthalmidae. The species is endemic to Trinidad and Tobago. ==Etymology== The specific name, shrevei, is in honor of American herpetologist Benjamin Shreve.Beolens B, Watkins M, Grayson (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore, Maryland: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Riama shrevei, p. 243). ==Habitat== The preferred natural habitats of O. shrevei are forest and freshwater wetlands, at altitudes of . ==Reproduction== O. shrevei is oviparous. ==References== ==Further reading== *Parker HW (1935). "The New Teiid Lizard in Trinidad". Tropical Agriculture, Trinidad 12 (11): 283. Category:Oreosaurus Category:Reptiles of Trinidad and Tobago Category:Endemic fauna of Trinidad and Tobago Category:Reptiles described in 1935 Category:Taxa named by Hampton Wildman Parker
title: Oreosaurus shrevei
